Reference¶

This is the class and function reference of MATRXS. Please refer to the tutorials for further details, as the class and function raw specifications may not be enough to give full guidelines on their uses.

World classes¶

Classes¶

matrxs.world_builder.WorldBuilder(shape[, …])

A builder to create one or more worlds.

matrxs.grid_world.GridWorld(shape, …[, …])

A representation of the MATRXS world as a grid.

Functions¶

matrxs.world_builder.WorldBuilder.worlds(…)

Returns a Generator of GridWorld instance for the specified number of worlds.

Agent brains¶

Classes¶

matrxs.agents.agent_brain.AgentBrain()

The class for creating agent brains.

matrxs.agents.human_agent_brain.HumanAgentBrain()

This is the HumanAgentBrain class.

matrxs.agents.patrolling_agent.PatrollingAgentBrain(…)

This is the PatrollingAgentBrain class.

matrxs.agents.capabilities.capability.SenseCapability(…)

This is the SenseCapability class.

Functions¶

matrxs.agents.agent_brain.AgentBrain.initialize(self)

Method called the very first time this AgentBrain is called from the world.

matrxs.agents.agent_brain.AgentBrain.filter_observations(…)

In this method you filter the state to only those properties and objects the agent is actually SUPPOSED to see.

matrxs.agents.agent_brain.AgentBrain.decide_on_action(…)

In this method you compute your action.

matrxs.agents.agent_brain.AgentBrain.send_message(…)

Method that allows you to construct a message that will be send to either a specified agent, a team of agents or all agents.

matrxs.agents.agent_brain.AgentBrain.is_action_possible(…)

Check whether the action is possible.

Objects¶

Classes¶

matrxs.objects.advanced_objects.Battery(location)

The class used to represent a battery

matrxs.objects.agent_body.AgentBody(…)

The class representing the agent body.

matrxs.objects.env_object.EnvObject(…[, …])

The basic class for all objects in the world.

matrxs.objects.simple_objects.SquareBlock(…)

A simple object class.

matrxs.objects.simple_objects.Door(location, …)

A class representing the door object.

matrxs.objects.simple_objects.Wall(location)

A class representing the wall object.

matrxs.objects.simple_objects.AreaTile(location)

A class representing the area tile object.

matrxs.objects.simple_objects.SmokeTile(location)

A class representing a smoke tile object.

Functions¶

matrxs.objects.advanced_objects.Battery.update(…)

Updates the current energy level, changes the property accordingly, and also change the visualization color.

matrxs.objects.agent_body.AgentBody._set_agent_busy(…)

specify the duration of the action in ticks currently being executed by the agent, and its starting tick

matrxs.objects.agent_body.AgentBody._check_agent_busy(…)

check if the agent is done with executing the action

matrxs.objects.agent_body.AgentBody._set_agent_changed_properties(…)

The Agent has possibly changed some of its properties during its OODA loop.

matrxs.objects.agent_body.AgentBody.change_property(…)

Changes the value of an existing (!) property.

matrxs.objects.agent_body.AgentBody.location

We override the location pythonic property here so we can override its setter.

matrxs.objects.agent_body.AgentBody.properties

Returns the custom properties of this object, but also any mandatory properties such as location, name, is_traversable and all visualization properties (those are in their own dictionary under ‘visualization’).
